title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire Friday 17 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: body found in river at holt fleet , worcester .
richard johnson narrowly loses out in gold cup race .
pershore fear it will lose out on new rail services .
£ 1m dream for hereford woman battling cancer .

documents.title: is this england 's steepest street ?
text: is this england 's steepest street ?
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: banning orders after pitch invasion
text: banning orders after pitch invasion

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: football : march to the arch continues for bromsgrove sporting
text: bromsgrove sporting are only 90 minutes away from a wembley appearance as they face the second leg of their fa vase semi-final at cleethorpes town tomorrow .
the tie is finely poised after the first leg at the victoria ground , which ended 1-1 .

documents.title: police attempt to identify river body
text: police are working to identify a man 's body which was pulled from the river severn in worcester this afternoon .
emergency services were called to the water near the holt fleet bridge in holt heath just after midday .
west midlands ambulance service says the man was retrieved from the river , but nothing could be done to save him .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch : warriors 'not out of this mess yet '
text: worcester warriors will need to keep their `` feet on the ground '' after their crucial win against bottom of the table bristol , according to their director of rugby .
gary gold told me the club is `` not out of this mess yet '' .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: flood alert for river wye
text: there 's a flood alert for the river wye in herefordshire .
heavy rain is expected over the weekend and levels are expected to peak on saturday afternoon , the environment agency says .
flood barriers are not expected to be deployed .

documents.title: weather : rain this evening and tomorrow
text: we 're forecast more rain this evening and tomorrow , so you might want to celebrate st patrick 's day indoors - or take an umbrella .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: three things you wanted to know
text: three things you wanted to know

documents.title: eastnor castle wins heritage award for loos
text: tourist attraction eastnor castle , near ledbury , has won a top industry award for the state of its loos .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: disappointment as paddling pool rescue bid fails
text: `` legal complications '' are being blamed for the failure of a bid to keep the paddling pool open in riverside north park , bewdley .
wyre forest district council , the friends of riverside north park and bewdley town council had been trying to reach an agreement which would have seen the pool transfered to the local community .
all three organisations have promised to continue to work together to bring about alternative features and improvements at the riverside park .

documents.title: severn valley railway steam gala gets under way
text: the severn valley railway has got its three-day steam gala under way today , with a number of guest locomotives visiting .
as well as all the usual activity , there will be goods trains and brake vans running up and down the tracks and up to 10 different locomotives in action .
there is also be a beer tent at the bewdley station and two new exhibitions at the highley engine house .

documents.title: johnson misses out in gold cup
text: johnson could n't follow up his earlier win at cheltenham with a winning ride in the gold cup race .
he finished third on native river , despite being in the mix right till the end .
sizing john ( 7-1 ) , ridden by robbie power , won ahead of minella rocco .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: richard johnson wins in triumph hurdle
text: herefordshire jockey richard johnson recorded his second win of the cheltenham festival earlier .
defi du seuil looked imperious on his way to success in the triumph hurdle .
`` he 's a horse who has improved every time , '' johnson told bbc radio 5 live .
`` in his first run at ffos las , i 'd have never thought he would become what he is today .
`` he has done everything so well and this is one to look out for in the future . ''
johnson has just set off in the gold cup race .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: body recovered from river severn in worcester
text: a body 's been pulled out of the river severn at holt fleet in worcester .
emergency services were initially called at around midday after reports of a person falling in .
the body has not yet been formally identified but it 's believed to be a man .

documents.title: no quick fix for council 's child protection services
text: council chiefs have admitted it could be five years before worcestershire 's failing children 's services gets a `` good '' grading .
author: Droitwich Spa Advertiser

documents.title: play area ownership transferred but with guarantees
text: ownership of a play area in wyre forest has been transferred from the district council to the parish council , but with a legal agreement that it must kept as a leisure facility .
rock parish council will take over running the far forest play area and its maintenance budget , if the move is approved by the secretary of state .

documents.title: rugby : te'o named on bench for ireland decider
text: worcester warriors centre ben te'o is once again on the bench as england chase a six nations grand slam in dublin .
as well as a starting berth against italy , te'o has made an explosive impact as a replacement so far in the competition , proving particularly effective against a tiring opposition .
we are a little bit vulnerable because we have already been crowned the six nations champions and we had a big win against scotland , so for us it 's getting the right mind-set for the game . ''
kick off is at 17:00 on saturday .

documents.title: slideshow : ducks , dogs , logs and blooms
text: here 's another selection of photos for you to enjoy from regular contributor , paul wilde .
he took them on the abbey meadows in redditch .
i 'd love to feature your photos - you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : crowds turn out for shire horses event
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , i 'll be live from what 's been called the largest shire horse competition in the world .
crowds will see 250 horses paraded over the next three days .
i 'll give you a taste of the event so far .
on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Ben Godfrey
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hunt for person reported in river
text: the emergency services are at the holt fleet pub in worcester after reports that someone has fallen into the river severn nearby .
we 'll bring you more as soon as we have it .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: hedgehog survives being trapped inside bale for five months
text: a plucky hedgehog is being nursed back to health after being trapped inside a plastic-wrapped haylage bale for five months .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: travel : four-day road closure near drakes broughton
text: the closure of mill lane , wadborough , starts on monday .
mill lane # wadborough , drakes broughton @ twitterid closed mon 20 mar for 4 days for road repairs
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cheltenham gold cup : all the best lizzie
text: lizzie kelly , riding tea for two who 's trained in upton-upon-severn , gets a good luck message from the county council - i wonder who 's drawn her in the office sweep stake .
good luck to @ twitterid who is the 2nd woman to ride in the # goldcup - she 's on board # worcestershire 's tea for two :

documents.title: waste plant is now 'fully operational '
text: a new plant that will turn 200,000 tonnes of waste a year into electricity is now `` fully operational '' , worcestershire county council says .
the envirecover plant on the hartlebury trading estate near kidderminster has taken 33 months to build .
it will process waste from herefordshire and worcestershire .

documents.title: basketball : 'it 's all clicking ' says wolves coach
text: worcester wolves head coach paul james feels things are coming together for his squad as they build towards the play-offs .
but he says there must be no let up when they head to leeds force for a bbl championship match tonight .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: slideshow : daybreak and daffs
text: the bbc 's army of weather watchers has been busy taking some great photos in herefordshire and worcestershire .
many thanks to j at severn ridge , mikesnapper , johnqa , happysnapper71 and morning amble for the photos .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: worcester news front page : man dies after car hits tree
text: today 's worcester news front page has the story of a man dying in an early-morning crash near worcester .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: cheltenham gold cup : local hopes for lizzie and tea for two
text: a worcestershire racehorse owner says having a runner in today 's gold cup at cheltenham will be the realisation of `` a lifelong dream '' .
len jakeman , from upton-upon-severn , owns tea for two , who 's already making history as lizzie kelly 's ride - she 's only the second woman to take part in the race .
it 's a dream any racehorse owner has got - i never thought that having a runner would happen to me , it 's a lifelong dream .
it 's the ultimate race to have a runner in . ''

documents.title: checks made on bouncers ' licences
text: door supervisors at worcester 's pubs , clubs and late night takeaways have been checked by the police and licencing officials .
officers from the national security industry authority ( sia ) , the police and the city council carried out the checks on friday , 3 march .
door staff at 28 premises were checked and all had the sia training and licence , the council says .
to get a licence door staff must have :
- the physical capability to intervene when required
- be trained in first aid techniques
- be able to deal with vulnerable people and people on their own who are in a vulnerable state
- be aware of terrorist threats
door supervisors regularly encounter violent situations ; they play a crucial role in protecting public safety and maintaining order .
i am pleased that door supervisors at all the premises inspected did have the right sia training and licence - important to ensuring the public stay safe while enjoying a night out in worcester . ''

documents.title: no quick fix : it could be 2022 before worcestershire 's child protection services are 'good '
text: council chiefs have admitted it could be five years before worcestershire 's failing children 's services gets a `` good '' grading .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: watch : cheltenham champion is now the family pet
text: i 've been to meet herefordshire 's champion jockey , richard johnson , who will be on board joint-favourite native river in today 's gold cup at the cheltenham festival .
he last won the gold cup 17 years ago , on looks like trouble , who now lives at johnson 's home .
author: Dan Pallett
BBC Midlands Today Sport

documents.title: lesbian couple 'turned down by worcester taxi driver '
text: a lesbian couple were refused permission to get into a worcester taxi - saying the shocking experience `` denied us our dignity '' .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: fears pershore will lose out on new rail services
text: plans to improve train services between worcester and london will have a `` negative effect '' on pershore , according to the town 's public transport group .

as well as completing a new worcestershire parkway station at nearby norton , the county council and great western railway hope to have brand new trains providing an hourly service by december 2018 , but it seems these wo n't call at pershore .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: malvern gazette front page : bobbies back on the beat
text: the front page of this week 's malvern gazette has the story of a promise to get police officers out of cars and back on the beat .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: video : will you need your brolly today ?

you can find a detailed weather report for your area here .

BBC Weather presenter

text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on friday morning .
this is how the early morning skies looked in hereford , as photographed by bbc weather watcher lounik .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: homeless posters : giving is 'a matter of personal choice ' says charity
text: a national charity helping homeless people says the decision whether to hand over cash , food or clothes `` should be a matter of personal choice '' .
the youth homelessness charity centrepoint was reacting to a poster campaign by redditch borough council , asking people in the town not to give to homeless people on the streets .
if a young person is sleeping rough , the priority must be to get them off the streets and into safe accommodation where they can access the support that they need . ''
the charity says anyone who is concerned about a homeless person can ring their helpline on 0808 800 0661 .
the council is encouraging people to use a special web page to provide a long-term solution .

documents.title: fire station officially opened
text: the new fire station in evesham has been officially opened today .
the ceremony was attended by the chief fire officer and the chairman of the fire authority , derek prodger .

documents.title: your questions : what 's the history of malvern hills ? part four
text: last part of our potted history of the malvern hills - sparked by an email sent to the bbc 's .
your questions .
the malvern hills are famous for their natural spring water wells - there are about 70 dotted across the hills .
in 1842 , two doctors set up their famous water cure in the town , which rapidly grew in fame - both dickins and darwin `` took the cure '' in malvern .
some of the wells are housed in elegant buildings , the best known of which is probably holywell .
the coming of the railway to the town , in 1860 , led a boom in tourism .
the better-off visitors came to great malvern station , and stayed at the luxurious imperial hotel , the first to be lit by incandescent gas .
it 's now a private girls ' school .
the less grand also came to walk on the hills , getting off at malvern link station .
the population of malvern in the 1861 census was given as 4,484 , yet on 28 july 1860 the malvern advertiser reported that 5,000 people arrived in the town for `` excursions '' .

in an editorial in june 1860 the malvern advertiser noted that some residents `` look on excursionists as a horde of barbarians , whose irruptions ( sic ) spoil peace , comfort and poetry they resent vulgar and noisy people coming among them '' .
local traders and publicans probably took a different view .
the hills remain big tourist attraction to this day .

documents.title: pupils unveil designs for new station
text: pupils at a school will have their designs displayed when the new worcestershire parkway station opens .

the station is being built near norton juxta kempsey cofe first school - the county council and slc rail visited pupils last year to explain the history of the line , and set pupils the challenge of designing the hoardings around the station .
it 's been great for the school to find out more about worcestershire parkway , especially as it ties-in with our curriculum .
the pupils were really excited to find out which designs had been selected and we ca n't wait to see them up on site . ''

documents.title: weather : rain overnight and into tomorrow
text: we 're going to have some rain moving in from the north overnight and there could be some showers tomorrow too .
check out the latest forecast for your area .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your questions : what 's the history of the malvern hills ? part three
text: after an email to the bbc 's .
your questions .
asking about the history of the malvern hills we 've already looked at the herefordshire beacon - known as british camp - and its iron age hill fort .
the highest point on the hills is the worcestershire beacon - which , as the name suggest - has been the site of warning fires since norman times .
the victorians in particular liked to build monstrous structures and set them ablaze - this one was built for queen victoria 's diamond jubilee .

writing in the malvern advertiser in july 1887 , a correspondent called worcestershire sauce described how `` the leaping cracking flames and the close volume of breeze-blown smoke circling and spreading over the dark outlined hillside , the town lit lit by the powerful ruddy glow of the blazing hills , the dark masses of the people silhouetted against the glare , all made for a never to be forgotten sight '' .
as the worcestershire beacon is 425m ( 1,395 ft ) high and if you look east the next highest hills are the urals in russia , a big fire can been seen from a long way away .
a letter writer in the same malvern advertiser watched the one lit for queen victoria 's golden jubilee from the top of the grandstand on worcester racecourse , 10 miles ( 16km ) away .
a system of organised warning beacons on high points across the country , including the malverns , had been in place since norman times .
a call to arms sent by beacon would travel far faster than a messenger on horseback .

the system was not foolproof though - in 1545 rumours spread of a french landing on the coast , the beacons were lit , and the worcestershire militia tramped all the way to swindon before they were told it was a false alarm .

documents.title: man with learning difficulties headbutted at station
text: a man with learning difficulties has been headbutted and punched in a `` totally unprovoked attack '' , police say .
british transport police say the 18-year-old was sitting on evesham station when a man got off a train , shouted at him , and then carried out the attack .
police have released a cctv image of a man they 'd like to speak to about the incident , which happened on 8 february .
the victim in this case has learning difficulties , and , although this attack is not believed to be because of that , it has left him deeply affected .
he is too scared to go near the railway station in case he sees his attacker .
it is simply not ok for someone to be living in such fear as a result of an incident like this . ''

documents.title: your questions : what 's the history of the malvern hills ? part two
text: we 've had an email for someone called coast , using .
your questions .
who asks : what 's the history behind the malvern hills ? ''
perhaps the most obvious piece of history on the hills is british camp - on the herefordshire beacon at the southern end of the hills .
according to the malvern hills conservators , the charity who look after the hills , british camp is an iron age hill fort , which probably had a later norman fort added on the top .
a plaque on the walk up to the top of british camp bears the local legend that the british chieftain caractacus made his last stand there .
it 's probably not true , but it did inspire the composer sir edward elgar , who loved the hills and lived in malvern for a time , to compose his cantata caractacus in 1898 .
coming next we move from the herefordshire beacon to the worcestershire beacon , the highest point on the hills , and the place where huge fires were lit to warn of coming danger .

documents.title: homeless posters : your comments
text: a poster campaign asking people if they are really helping homeless people by giving them donations of cash , refreshments or clothing has been launched by redditch borough council .
here are a selection of the comments you 've been making on the bbc hereford & worcester facebook page .
i used to work with the homeless and you should never give money or food , in fact do n't give anything as you are helping to keep them in that lifestyle .
give the money to local charities that help , if you really want to do good then find out what is available so you can inform anyone that 's homeless . ''
most live better than a lot of pensioners . ''

documents.title: your questions : the malvern hills - what 's the story ? part one
text: we 've had an email for someone called coast , using .
your questions who asks : what 's the history behind the malvern hills ? ''
that 's a very big question that takes in pre-cambrian geology , the ice age , iron age hill forts , warning beacons and even the music of elgar - so here goes .
let 's start with the geology - how this distinctive range of hills standing out from the flat flood plain of the river severn came to be .
the hills are protected by an act of parliament , and looked after by a charity called the malvern hills conservators .
it says the rocks that make up the hills are known as schists and gneisses , and date from the pre-cambrian period between 600 and 800 million years ago .
the rock is very hard , and for years were .
quarried to be used in road building , among other things .
the damage the quarries did was very controversial - george bernard shaw said the malvern hills were in danger of becoming `` the malvern flats '' .
the first malvern hills act was passed in 1884 , but there was quarrying going on right up until 1977 .
this slideshow shows some of the quarries as they were and as they are now - of the old quarries courtesy of the malvern hill conservators .
coming up next - .
hill forts , roman seiges and warning beacons

documents.title: city runners offered the chance to train with steve cram and a 'mystery guest '
text: runners planning to take part in the worcester city half marathon and 10k run are being offered the chance to take part in a free training session with former world champion steve cram and a `` mystery guest '' .
runners have to apply by email to take part in the training session , which involves a meet and greet session with steve cram followed by `` an easy 5k run '' .
the training session takes place at the new perdiswell leisure centre , on thursday , 23 march at 19:45 .
the half marathon and 10k runs take place on 17 september .

documents.title: man dies as car hits tree
text: a man has died after his car hit a tree this morning near upton snodsbury in worcestershire .
it happened on the a422 , just before 8:50 , west midlands ambulance service said .
two ambulances and a paramedic were dispatched , but the man was confirmed dead at the scene .
there were no other injuries .

documents.title: big funding award for wildlife reserves
text: wildlife reserves in worcestershire have been given a grant of £ 30,000 from an environmental fund .
worcestershire wildlife trust , which manages the reserves , says the money will be used for tree surveys , opening up sunny woodland rides , bracken control and boardwalk repairs .

the money will be used at piper 's hill common , near hanbury ( above ) , the devil 's spittleful and pound green common , near bewdley , ipsley alders marsh in redditch , tiddesley wood in pershore , and eades meadow near bromsgrove ( below ) .

documents.title: regions share £ 20m lottery culture fund
text: regions share £ 20m lottery culture fund

documents.title: paedophile hunter : 'police too stretched '
text: paedophile hunter : 'police too stretched '

documents.title: homeless posters : why the council has launched its 'hard-hitting'campaign
text: a `` hard-hitting '' poster campaign asking people if they are really helping homeless people by giving them donations of cash , refreshments or clothing has been launched by redditch borough council .

the council says giving homeless people change or even food and drink `` does not tackle the underlying issue of homelessness '' and actually `` facilitates and sometimes encourages a street presence '' .
the council says it is working to `` strongly encourage '' homeless people to `` come off the streets '' or change their `` street profile '' .
the kindness of people can sometimes inadvertently support a street presence cycle - and it 's not a solution to ending that . ''

documents.title: plans submitted to extend leominster cemetery
text: a cemetery which is running out of burial space could be extended .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: paedophile hunters : police 'should n't shut themselves away '
text: a police boss and qc has called for closer links between the police and groups who hunt paedophiles .

vera baird qc , the police and crime commissioner for the northumberia force , said : `` the police do need to acknowledge that these groups are likely to continue to do what they are doing and that the public are not opposed to that . ''
a hereford man claims he has received hundreds of suggestive messages and explicit texts after he posed as a 14-year-old girl online .
ms baird says her forces tries to recruit paedophile hunters as `` special constables and therefore do this as fully-warranted officers , or as police volunteers . ''
if you have evidence about something like this , you should tell the police , and let them deal with it .
that would be everybody 's position .
however , many of these groups have already been told that and they intend nonetheless to carry on because they feel they can make a contribution . ''

documents.title: slideshow : the sun has n't got his hat on
text: in stark contrast to yesterday , there is a lot of cloud cover about - but the bbc 's army of weather watchers have still been providing some great photographs .
these come from mikesnapper , ricardo , happysnapper71 , morning amble and j at severn ridge .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: school report : student interviews teacher of refugee pupil
text: pacey , a student at birmingham 's john henry newman catholic college , would normally have been in a history lesson but today he has been interviewing a teacher from another school as part of bbc school report news day .
in a way , though , history was still the topic - they were discussing the experiences of one of the teacher 's pupils , rony ; a refugee from syria .
rony ( below ) attends balaam wood school , in frankley .
pacey said rony 's story was interesting because `` he 's had to leave so much behind and try and start afresh '' .

documents.title: paedophile hunter : police arrest and conviction figures
text: a paedophile hunter from hereford say he 's `` not trying to do the police 's work '' , but claims he 's received hundred of suggestive or offensive texts or messages while posing as a 14-year-old girl online .
david john poole has also confronted several people in person who 've contacted him online .
west mercia police say they `` do not encourage members of the public to pursue their own investigations '' .

documents.title: people encouraged not to donate to homeless
text: people are being asked to consider if they are really helping homeless people by giving them cash , refreshments and clothes in a `` hard-hitting '' campaign by a council .
redditch borough council says it is putting up posters around the town and on social media after the appearance of a makeshift camp in the borough .
we want to offer long-term solutions for these people and unfortunately , acts of kindness from the public are not tackling the underlying issues .
these posters may seem hard-hitting but we have to break this cycle . ''

documents.title: worcester news front page : fighting children closed youth club
text: children from across the city are travelling to dines green to cause trouble and get into fights , according to a concerned charity chief .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: school report : pupils take to the air
text: the pupils at tudor grange academy in worcester have been taking to the airwaves as part of the bbc 's school report day .
ben and tom have been having a go at reading a sports bulletin .
jacob and poppy have been getting to grips with reporting live from bbc hereford & worcester 's radio car .

documents.title: children 's artwork helps decorate care home construction site
text: bromsgrove school children have created a piece of eye-catching artwork to brighten up the building site of the town 's newest care home .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: watch : 'i do the research ' says paedophile hunter
text: i 've been to meet david john poole , the hereford man who has set up a group to hunt paedophiles .
he poses as a 14-year-old girl online and says he receives hundreds of suggestive and indecent texts and messages .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : mystery of yellow ribbons munitions girls tribute solved
text: we 've been searching for the mystery artists who created their own tribute to the rotherwas `` canary girls '' in the middle of a farmer 's field .

a tree decorated with yellow dusters appeared just after we 'd launched our campaign to get national recognition for the men and women who worked in munitions factories like rotherwas , in hereford , and blackpole , in worcester .
the women who worked there during ww1 had their skin died yellow by the chemicals they used , and were nicknamed `` canary girls '' .
after much searching i 've tracked down the artists .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: paedophile hunters : cases brought to court
text: vigilante groups who hunt paedophiles by posing as underage girls claim success in several high profile court cases :
mark mckenna , 38 , who sent explicit photos , a video and many messages to someone he believed was an 11-year-old girl
paul platten , 38 , who sent naked of himself to a vigilante posing as a 13-year-old girl ,
andrew sealey , 39 , who was caught in a sting operation in a theme park after telling one fake teenager : `` it 's ok you being a virgin and 15 , i do n't mind . ''
all were convicted in court with evidence from the vigilantes forming part of the prosecution .

documents.title: watch : widow appeals for more meningitis injections
text: a widow from kidderminster says many deaths could be prevented if more people were vaccinated against meningitis .
di spalding lost her husband john , who was a gp , .
to a rare form of the condition in 2014 at the age of only 55 , just hours after he became ill .
she wants younger people in particular to protect themselves .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: paedophile hunter : 'i 'm not trying to do the police 's work '
text: a hereford man who has set up a group who hunt paedophiles says he is not trying to `` do the police 's work '' .
david john poole poses as a 14-year-old girl online and says he gets sent hundreds of suggestive messages and explicit sent to him .
he also carries out `` stings '' , where he has arranged to meet the alleged paedophiles in person , before calling the police with his evidence .
west mercia police say they `` do not encourage members of the public to pursue their own investigations '' .
the force says it can `` compromise ongoing police investigations '' .
i 'm not trying to do the police 's work , but i think they do need people like us .
people just see me doing the 'sting ' but i literally study the law .
i have studied other paedophile hunting groups , what they do , what you ca n't say .
believe it or not i do do the research behind it all . ''
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: cheltenham festival : johnson 's 'good chance ' in the gold cup
text: richard johnson is gearing up for his attempt at a second gold cup at the cheltenham festival .
the pembridge-based rider is flying high after yesterday , winning the fred winter juvenile handicap hurdle on flying tiger - at odds of 33-1 .
johnson says there are just a handful of horses he thinks are able to win the gold cup - but he stands a good chance tomorrow with native rider .

documents.title: paedophile 'hunter ' says police are too stretched to cope
text: a hereford man has told me he set up a group hunting paedophiles because the police are `` too stretched to cope '' .
david john poole formed an organisation he calls `` h division '' about four weeks ago - he poses as a 14-year-old girl online .
he 's since been sent hundreds of suggestive messages and explicit
he 's also performed several `` sting '' operations , where he meets the alleged paedophiles in person , before calling the police with his evidence .
west mercia police say identifying alleged paedophiles is best left to them as they can ensure vulnerable victims are protected .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: video : where 's the sunshine gone ?
text: not as nice as yesterday , with some fog around first thing , then a cloudy day with the potential for drizzle later on with highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
you can find a full forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on thursday morning .
it 's a cloudy start to the day , as this photo from bbc weather watcher happysnapper71 shows .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from our coverage on wednesday .
please join us again from 08:00 on thursday for more news , sport , travel and weather updates .
any breaking news will be posted here overnight .

documents.title: slideshow : up close with nature
text: frogs , sheep , birds and blossom - they 've all provided great subjects for this selection of photos from bbc weather watchers .
thanks to morning amble , lounik , postman les , and j at severn ridge for the snaps .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: £ 100,000 revamp of rubery village
text: the revamp of rubery village centre , which will cost £ 100,000 , has been confirmed and is set to get under way in the coming weeks .
author: Bromsgrove Standard

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: a vision of the future of wolverhampton has gone on show on the french riviera , at a conference for developers from around the world .
bmw workers in coleshill could be going out on strike , in protest at the car maker 's plans to end their final salary pension scheme .

and a total of 261 drivers have been given new heavier fines for using mobile phones at the wheel in one week , including one on the m5 motorway who had a bank statement in their hand and who was trying to access online banking on their phone at the same time .
more on these stories and others on the midlands today on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: rugby : valkyries players called up for england duty
text: worcester valkyries prop forward rochelle clark will win her 121st cap for england women as they go in search of the grand slam against ireland in dublin on friday evening .
her worcester team mates laura keates , bianca blackburn and lydia thompson are all on the replacements bench .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: domestic abuser 'first ' to be jailed for controlling behaviour in a relationship
text: a domestic abuser has become the first man in worcestershire to be jailed for engaging in controlling or coercive behaviour , according to police .
kyle scott , 23 , from lincoln , was jailed for 20 months and made the subject of a restraining order lasting five years or until further order at worcester crown court after admitting the charge .

scott subjected his victim to weeks of threatening and violent behaviour including using a knife to assault her , damaging her property , blocking her social media accounts , taking her car keys and using psychological abuse , .
west mercia police said .

documents.title: watch : a clear night ahead but turning cloudy tomorrow
text: it will be a clear and settled start to the evening .
it will feel cool under clear skies , allowing areas of fog to develop through the early hours .
however , it should remain dry for most - lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow will be much cloudier , with outbreaks of light rain expected through the afternoon .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football club goes back to school to help its players
text: kidderminster harriers and baxter college have teamed up to encourage players to continue their education as they train at the club .
the partnership will be managed by the school 's head of pe , dave garbett , a former walsall fc coach .
the life of a professional footballer is relatively short and precarious .
we recognise the importance of having the best qualifications so that our bright and talented young footballers - boys and girls - can keep their options open and have the best chances in life . ''
groundbreaking news to bring you today as harriers and @ twitterid launch a-level programme for september details

documents.title: final phase of town centre improvements to be completed by the autumn
text: the final stage of work to improve the centre of tenbury wells will be completed by the autumn , the council has announced .
the work will involve improvements to the paths and the installation of new street furniture on teme street .
the first phase of work , between crow corner and the end of market square , was completed in spring 2015 .
the second phase of the refurbishment is currently being completed by contractors working on behalf of tesco , who are opening a new store in the town in april , the council says .

documents.title: row breaks out over council house revenue
text: a row has broken out over the amount of revenue generated by buildings hired out by bromsgrove district council for special events and private functions .
author: Bromsgrove Standard

documents.title: harriers set up partnership with college
text: a new partnership between kidderminster harriers and a secondary school will mean members of its academy can now take up to three a-levels .
there will be 40 places available at baxter college in the town from september .
there will also be opportunities for some players to progress to harriers ' higher education degree course which is set to kick off next autumn .

documents.title: man in hospital after van overturns outside bromyard
text: a man has been taken to hospital after his van overturned on the worcester road just outside bromyard this morning .
paramedics were called to the road just before 06:20 .
he was taken to hereford county hospital with leg and back injuries .

documents.title: unemployment rises in bromsgrove , but drops nationally
text: the number of people claiming unemployment benefits in bromsgrove has risen , despite worcestershire and the uk as a whole seeing a drop .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: rubery village to be spruced up thanks to £ 100k funding
text: lights , bus shelters , benches , bollards and other features of rubery village will undergo improvements after a £ 100,000 funding package was agreed .
the largest chunk of the money , £ 75,000 , has come from bromsgrove district council , while worcestershire county council has put in £ 25,000 .
part of the plan is to include a so-called `` quality charter '' for future works and to ensure the improved features are maintained .

documents.title: poems 'powerful tribute to dead son '
text: the mother of a worcestershire schoolboy who took is own life says a book of poems being published in his memory is a wonderful tribute to her son .
seventeen-year-old felix alexander died last year after years of being bullied online .
felix 's mum lucy - who 's been campaigning against bullying in schools - says she hopes other people find the book inspiring .
it 's the most phenomenal legacy for him , it 's incredibly touching .
i 've been able to see two of the poems written by jackie kay and they are the most incredibly powerful and moving poems and intensely personal . ''

documents.title: international investment could bring more jobs to worcestershire
text: the government says thousands of jobs could be created in worcestershire by international investors as part of the its new midlands engine plan .
it has highlighted 19 projects across the region which it thinks have the opportunity for investment from abroad .
they include the worcester technology park and redditch eastern gateway .

documents.title: new link road set for three days of overnight work
text: the latest stage of work on worcester 's southern link road will take place next week .
the county council says a first phase of drainage and surfacing works on the a4440 has been completed .
the authority says the next will take place overnight for three days from 24 march between 18:00 and 09:00 each night .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: urban village plan for kidderminster boosted by government cash
text: council bosses in wyre forest have welcomed a slice of government cash that will boost plans for a new housing and retail development in kidderminster .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : regeneration plans set to create jobs
text: this lunchtime on midlands today - how thousands of jobs could be created in part of the region through a regeneration plan .
plus we 'll have the latest unemployment figures and news of a pension protest by car workers in the midlands .
those stories along with your lunchtime weather forecast .
on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Giles Latcham
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: thousands of identity fraud victims in west midlands
text: identity fraud in the west midlands is at record levels , according to a national campaign group .
the credit industry fraud avoidance service ( cifas ) says there were nearly 11,500 cases in the region last year with most of it happening online .
nationally there were almost 173,000 recorded frauds in 2016 , 3,000 more than in 2015 .
cifas says people must be more vigilant about protecting their personal data .
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: rugby : three warriors ' players in england under-20 squad
text: will butler ( joe morris and justin clegg have been named as replacements as england under-20s go for a six nations grand slam against ireland at donnybrook stadium on friday .
england are aiming to win their first six nations grand slam since 2011 and the game .
is part of a double header at donnybrook , with england women also vying to secure the grand slam in their fixture against ireland .

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser back page : get to wembley and we frame your pants
text: bromsgrove sporting boss paul smith is under pressure to have his lucky pants framed and put on display in the board room if the club can book their place at wembley in the fa vase final this weekend .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: defibrillator goes '24-hour '
text: a defibrillator in redditch town centre is now available 24 hours a day , the council says .
the life-saving machine was previously kept behind the counter at of redditch borough council 's offices in walter stranz square .
the defibrillator is now kept in a secure cabinet outside the offices , and is available to use at all times by dialling 999 and quoting the code on the door .

documents.title: slideshow : misty fields and spring sunshine
text: the bbc 's army of weather watchers have been out getting some great of the sun breaking through the early morning mist .
this selection comes from j at severn ridge , fayecd26 , morning amble , mikesnapper , tenbury phil and hs71 .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: unemployment up 9,000 in west midlands in latest figures
text: unemployment in the west midlands rose by 9,000 to 160,000 in the three months to january , official figures show .
they show the region saw the joint-largest jobless increase compared with the rest of the country - five other areas also saw rises .
it means the current unemployment rate in the west midlands is 5.6 % , the office for national statistics said .
that compares with the uk unemployment rate falling to 4.7 % , its lowest rate in 41 years in the three months to january .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: start of 'close season ' for coarse fishing
text: the environment agency says its enforcement teams will rigorously police a ban on coarse fishing that comes into force from today .
the three-month break gives shoals of fish such as barbel and chub and chance to breed , for numbers to replenish .
quick - there is still a few hours left !
# gofishing but not on river # closeseason !
could it be possible that all fishing licence holders be allowed to vote as to whether the river closed season should remain

documents.title: call for hospital review to be put on hold
text: a campaign group has called for a review of worcestershire 's main hospitals to be put on hold following the death of an eight-year-old boy who had to be taken to the worcestershire royal hospital , despite living on the doorstep of redditch 's alexandra hospital .
callum cartlidge died soon after arriving at hospital .
he suffered a cardiac arrest at home after developing suspected sepsis , sources told the bbc .
he had been discharged from hospital less than 24 hours earlier .
the hospital trust said it was investigating
paramedics were allegedly told to take him 18 miles ( 29km ) to worcestershire hospital and not nearby alexandra hospital in redditch , which .
stopped admitting children to a & e in september .
campaign group our nhs worcestershire is planning a protest at the meeting of the redditch and bromsgrove clinical commissioning group next week .

documents.title: delays on trains between redditch and lichfield
text: there are delays on trains between redditch and lichfield after an earlier incident .
operator london midlands warned trains may be delayed by more than 30 minutes , or cancelled .
due to the emergency services dealing with an incident earlier between redditch & lichfield tv , trains may be cancelled , delayed > 30 minutes
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser front page : £ 7.5m to relieve a38 congestion
text: a huge £ 7.5m will be ploughed into bromsgrove to carry out `` desperately needed '' upgrades to the a38 , helping to reduce traffic congestion and create jobs and investment .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: cheltenham festival : local runners
text: local trainers will have horses running on the second day of the cheltenham festival .
byton trainer kerry lee is due to send out top gamble ( in the queen mother champion chase , while the michael scudamore-trained kingswell theatre is due to run in the cross-country chase .
towards the end of today 's card , venetia williams has candy burg in the fred winter juvenile handicap hurdle .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: ambulance service confirms twitter hack
text: west midlands ambulance service has confirmed its twitter account was hacked this morning .
the tweet which went up at around 07:00 carried text supporting the turkish president recep tayyip erdogan who is in a feud with germany and the netherlands .
the post was deleted shortly afterwards .
the ambulance service says it 's now removed the post and changed its passwords and security settings .

other twitter accounts also appeared to have been hacked overnight including the bbc north america account which tweeted at : `` hi everyone - we temporarily lost control of this account , but normal service has resumed .
thanks . ''
hi everyone - we temporarily lost control of this account , but normal service has resumed .
thanks .
that would explain this
@ twitterid @ twitterid having temporarily lost control of the country will normal service be resumed there too # trump
@ twitterid has been hacked too - you got same password or something ? ? ! !
@ twitterid
terrible-glad you recovered .
uh k ?
author: Phil Bowers
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: parents of boy who died from a brain tumour lobby mps for more research
text: the parents of a boy from worcestershire who died from an aggressive brain tumour are calling for more money to be spent researching the condition .
finlay church from alvechurch was just 11 when he died in 2015 .
he had been diagnosed just 17 months earlier .
brain tumours kill more children and adults under the age of 40 than any other cancer but get just 1 % of the national spend on research .
his parents , wayne and penny , say people need to be aware of how quickly the condition can end someone 's life .
we 've been funding research into breast cancer and leukaemia , and made progress .
i think that 's absolutely wonderful but research into brain cancer has been left behind . ''

documents.title: watch : a dry and bright day ahead
text: skies will be partly cloudy today with some sunny spells at times .
it will stay dry through the day and it will feel mild in the sunshine and light winds - highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on wednesday morning .
there 's been a misty start to the day , as you can see from this photo taken by bbc weather watcher hillman .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cyclist seriously injured after being thrown from her bike
text: a cyclist has suffered serious injuries after being thrown over the handlebars of her bike , the ambulance service say .
west midlands ambulance say it was called to bates hill in redditch just before midday .
the woman , believed to be in her 20s , was taken to the queen elizabeth hospital birmingham for further emergency care .
no other vehicle was involved , the police say .

documents.title: stephen woolley : family of missing man raise money for charity
text: the family of a man whose body was found in the river severn after he had been missing for 12 weeks are raising money in his memory for a support charity .
stephen woolley , a 55-year-old retired bank manager , .
went missing from his home in kidderminster .
on 6 december .
the family are raising money missing people , which they say is `` an amazing charity who do so many good things to help those whose loved ones are missing '' .

documents.title: warriors ' fans wig tribute : other players with 'distinctive ' hairstyles
text: some warriors ' fans at sunday 's crucial relegation game against bristol were wearing curly wigs in tribute to the distinctive hairstyle of the flanker , chris vui .
the player called their tonsorial tribute `` pretty cool '' , but he 'll have to go some to won the title of rugby 's most outstanding hairstyle .
have a look at joe marler ( top right ) , marland yarde ( top right ) and richard hibbard ( bottom right ) and compare them to chris vui ( bottom left ) l .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: locomotives arrive on the back of a lorry
text: the severn valley railway is celebrating its spring steam gala this weekend and a number of visiting locomotives have been arriving on the back of lorries this week .
earlier this afternoon this br standard 9f was delivered to its bridgnorth station by the great central railway .
it has been described by the severn valley railway as `` one of the most powerful steam locomotives in britain '' and it 's one of three making a guest appearance .

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' player 'honoured ' by fans ' wig tribute
text: flanker chris vui says he was surprised but honoured to see warriors ' fans donning curly wigs as a tribute to his distinctive hairstyle .
there were plenty of the wigs to be seen in the crowd at the warrior 's crucial win in the relegation showdown against bristol at sixways on sunday .
`` i grew my hair just to try something new , so to see fans wearing wigs was pretty cool . ''
chris vui says it was 'pretty cool ' to see fans donning wigs in his honour during warriors ' victory over bristol

documents.title: stuck lorry blocks road for three hours
text: a lorry became stuck in a narrow road in worcester , something a local firm said is becoming `` a regular occurance '' .
park street in worcester was blocked for about three hours , according to sutcliffe & co insurance brokers , who took this photo .

documents.title: delight as bromsgrove boosted by £ 7.5 million for `` desperately needed '' upgrades to the a38
text: a huge £ 7.5 million will be ploughed into bromsgrove to carry out desperately needed '' upgrades to the a38 , helping to reduce traffic congestion and create jobs and investment .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: politics of marriage and divorce
text: politics of marriage and divorce
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: school ww1 project gets 10k lottery grant
text: a worcestershire primary school has received £ 10,000 from the heritage lottery fund to help mark the centenary of world war one .
the project , called grimley and holt remembered , will see members of the local community sharing items such as photographs and letters from the war to form an online archive .
pupils at the primary school will design some replica stained glass windows for the local church , as well as getting the chance to visit the battlefields of northern france and belgium .

documents.title: your photos : mixed weather in worcestershire
text: it 's been a mixed day weather-wise today , as you can see from these photos taken by the bbc weather watchers this afternoon .
they were taken within two hours of each other in lower broadheath ( top ) and kidderminster ( below ) and show very different scenes .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'pause ' over national insurance changes is the right move , says county mp
text: worcester 's mp has welcomed the brakes being put on a controversial tax rise for 1.6 million people - saying it needs `` careful '' thought .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: songs of praise in hereford for easter
text: the cathedral is getting ready to welcome the bbc .
we 've got a bbc technical team with us today doing a site visit for our easter day broadcast and # songsofpraise - very exciting !

documents.title: pedestrian crossing proposed for a40 at wilton roundabout in ross-on-wye
text: kier highways is carrying out a consultation on installing a toucan crossing 40 metres to the east of the roundabout on the a40 .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: hospitals 'struggling ' to recruit nurses and junior doctors
text: a hospital trust says it is struggling to recruit enough nurses and junior doctors .

the trust which runs the alexandra hospital in redditch and the worcestershire royal in worcester , were given a deadline of the 10 march to improve patient care , by the nhs watchdog , the care quality commission .
richard beeken , who is in charge until the new permanent chief executive starts later this month , says they are determined to fill all their vacancies .

we 've got over 200 qualified nursing vacancies in the organisation and also , not unlike many hospitals in the land , we 've got a problem recruiting to junior doctor posts - doctors in training who provide backup and are a crucial part of the service .
we 're not alone in this , but we 've got to try every trick in the book [ to fill vacancies ] . ''

documents.title: slideshow : blue skies break through the clouds
text: there was a cloudy start to the morning , but the sun has now broken through in many places , as these photos from .
bbc weather watchers show .
thanks to mikesnapper , morning amble and johnqa for the photos .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: concern that most cyber crime goes unreported
text: figures show there were nearly six million fraud and cyber crime cases across the country in a year - including 4,557 in the west mercia area .
the cases - many involving online banking - were reported by .
action fraud in the year prior to september last year .
but police forces are concerned that most still go unreported - leaving many victims `` forgotten '' .

documents.title: coming up on midlands today
text: a staffordshire farmer loses his cattle herd after an outbreak of bovine tb and a warning over internet scams .
all this and more on midlands today , bbc one at 13.30 .
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: derelict pub to be demolished for flats
text: a derelict hereford pub is set to be demolished to make way for 35 affordable flats .
herefordshire housing will be building the new homes on the site of the ship inn on ross road .
the pub has been empty for more than a decade and work will begin this week on making the site secure and preparing it for demolition next month .

documents.title: crisis-hit worcestershire acute hospitals trust ranked worst for patients waiting more than 12 hours in a & e
text: more patients are enduring 12-hour `` trolley waits '' to be admitted into hospital in worcestershire than anywhere else in the country , shock figures reveal .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: cinderella sports ground : a brief history
text: the cinderella sports ground , on bransfield road in worcester , could become `` a centre for local cricket and football '' under plans being put forward by the city council and a further education college .
the ground was the original home of worcestershire county cricket club .
- the pavilion dates from 1876 and was used by workers from willis ' cinderella shoe factory , becoming known as the cinderella sports ground
- world-renowned cricketer wg grace ( played there in 1870 , at the age of 20
- it hosted the first australian touring side in 1878

documents.title: travel : delays on trains between worcester and hereford
text: network rail say a signalling problem between great malvern and worcester foregate street is delaying trains by up to 30 minutes .
due to a signalling fault between great malvern & worcester foregate street services running through these stations may be cancelled/delayed
first day of cheltenham .
well done lads
we are not responsible for the infrastructure martyn
back moving thankfully !
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : how the weather nags at the races
text: when the going gets tough , the tough get checking the weather forecast , or at least those who want to a winner at the races do .
as cheltenham festival 2017 gets under way , bbc weather 's rebecca wood explains about having a flutter in the wind and more .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: the original home of worcestershire cricket club could be a sports ground again
text: the original home of worcestershire county cricket club , where wg grace once played , could be transformed into `` a centre for local cricket and football '' .
the cinderella sports ground , on bransford road in worcester , has been derelict since it closed in 2007 .
the ground 's ornate historic pavilion ( is currently still in place , but has deteriorated to a point where it can not be restored .
the council has been negotiating with heart of worcestershire college to jointly refurbish the sports ground and to sublet it to the college on a peppercorn rent .
funding from the council , the college , sport england , a private donator and from financial contributions made by developers will `` help revive the site '' , a spokesman says .
if the plan is approved the ground could be back in use by autumn next year .

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire hope hastings will be fit for first game
text: worcestershire 's overseas signing , john hastings , remains `` on schedule '' to be fit to play in the first championship match of the season .
the australian all-rounder is recovering from patella tendon surgery in the winter .
the county hope the 31-year-old will be able to take the field when they take on glamorgan at the swalec stadium , on 14 april .
rhodes : '' we are anticipating he will be available for first game of season .
at the moment , he is on course . ''

documents.title: inquest into death of eight-year-old boy is adjourned
text: the inquest into the death of eight-year-old from redditch who died a day after being discharged from hospital has been adjourned until 28 june .
callum cartlidge suffered a cardiac arrest at home in redditch after developing suspected sepsis , the bbc has been told .
he had been diagnosed with tonsilitis .
paramedics were allegedly told to take him 18 miles ( 29km ) to worcestershire hospital and not nearby alexandra hospital in redditch , which .
stopped admitting children to a & e in september .
worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust is investigating what happened .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: bulls crowd trouble : club determined to rid themselves of 'small minority '
text: the bulk of hereford fc fans are `` excellent ambassadors for the club '' and recent crowd troubles have been caused by `` a small minority '' , the club chairman says .
ken kinnersley says the club is determined to `` rid itself of these elements '' .
the bulls ' southern league division one south and west match at didcot town in march was abandoned because of crowd trouble .

a 19-year-old man from hereford was arrested on sus of a public order offence , and a 19-year-old man from hereford was arrested on sus of common assault following the trouble , thames valley police said .
both men have been bailed until april .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: what 's that helicopter doing flying so low ?
text: if you spot a yellow helicopter flying low over worcester today , it 's checking overhead lines for western power distribution .
they love you to photograph it as well , just in case they 've forgotten what it looks like .
our helicopters are patrolling overhead lines in # worcester # somerset # stoke # tycoch today .
thanks @ twitterid for the # wpdspotted

documents.title: racing : cheltenham hopes for venetia williams
text: the cheltenham festival opens today and herefordshire trainer venetia williams will have vic de touzaine in the ultima handicap chase .
the aramstone yard is also due to have both zamdy man ( and burton 's well in the final race of the day - the novices handicap chase .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your 'daff-ed ' cats
text: these cats , playing among the spring daffodils in pershore , were photographed by bbc weather watcher , strictlyballroom .

you can .
