documents.title: energy bill saving scheme considered by council
text: a scheme to help people in the wyre forest save money off their gas and electricity bills could be introduced .
plans to start at a collective energy switching scheme will be discussed at a council meeting this evening .
it would see lots of people change to the same energy supplier , chosen by the council , to get a better deal .

documents.title: dog trainer to be sentenced over lamb deaths
text: a 64-year-old dog trainer is due to be sentenced later after he admitted allowing his two dogs to kill and injure more than 50 lambs .

charles ross-robertson , from stanton lacy , ludlow , pleaded guilty at hereford crown court in january to allowing his rotweiller cross dogs to attack the sheep in a field at risbury near leominster .
he 's due to appear at worcester crown court today .
an application has been made for the dogs to be put down .

documents.title: parents raise money to help keep hay-on-wye swimming pool open
text: a parents group .
raising money to keep their community swimming pool open have raised £ 475 by bag packing at a local supermarket .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: inquest into death of eight-year old boy opens later
text: the inquest into the death of an eight-year-old boy who died a day after being discharged from hospital opens later .
callum cartlidge suffered a cardiac arrest at home in redditch after developing suspected sepsis , the bbc has been told .
he had been diagnosed with tonsilitis .
paramedics were allegedly told to take him 18 miles ( 29km ) to worcestershire hospital and not nearby alexandra hospital in redditch , which .
stopped admitting children to a & e in september .
worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust is investigating what happened .

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: after a cloudy start , a few brighter intervals are possible ; feeling mild with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from tuesday 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on tuesday morning .
not such a bright start to the day .
as you can see from this early morning photo from bbc weather watcher happysnapper71 .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: tennis court facelift a step closer
text: a campaign to upgrade tennis facilities in droitwich spa received a boost today , after wychavon district council agreed to provide an extra £ 10,000 .
the group let 's play tennis needs to raise £ 40,000 to refurbish the courts at the lido park - this latest grant means the council will now be meeting three quarters of the total cost .
we 're thrilled with this additional funding which gets us so much closer to our final goal .
we still have a lot of money to raise though , so we are once again calling on the community as well as local businesses to give what they can to this project . ''

documents.title: plan for pleasure boats in hereford
text: there are plans for pleasure boats to be put on the river wye in hereford to host school trips and parties .
campaigners are hoping to introduce boats on the water in the city by next year , similar to the ones used at symonds yat and in worcester .
gary wilding from the left bank , where the boats could be moored , says there 's lots of potential .
obviously we operate a lot of weddings from the left bank , so no doubt the wedding parties will operate on the boats as well .
the registrars are quite happy to marry people on the boat , so we 'll no doubt have a few ceremonies on the boat as well . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your photos : bloomin ' marvellous
text: spring has arrived in worcestershire - thanks to bbc weather watchers feline ferocity in redditch and toppo in doddenham for these beautiful of blossom across the county .

documents.title: ross-on-wye dog owner wins at crufts
text: a ross-on-wye dog owner won a prize at crufts with his three-year-old welsh pembroke corgi , magnus .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : mountain of waste fly-tipped on woodland
text: on midlands today this evening - more fly-tipping as around 200 tonnes of commercial rubbish has been dumped on private woodland .
fly-tippers drove lorry-loads of waste on to the enville estate on tuesday afternoon .
we 'll have the full story including the cost of clean-up from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : tonight and tomorrow 's weather forecast for the west midlands
text: after a bright , sunny day today , here 's how tonight and tomorrow are shaping up .
you can also keep up-to-date with the latest forecast at the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: stone attack : ambulance 'could have left the road '
text: an attack on an ambulance carrying an elderly cardiac patient to the worcestershire royal hospital could have been much more serious and even caused the vehicle to leave the road , according to west midlands ambulance service .

the driver of the ambulance was left covered in glass after a gang of youths threw a stone through the front side passenger window , as it was travelling past the mitre oak pub on the a449 just after midnight on sunday morning .
a second ambulance had to be sent out to hartlebury to take the patient to hospital .
although police did attend and searched the area , there was no trace of the three youths .
thankfully , no-one was seriously hurt , but we could easily have ended up with the vehicle leaving the road and then who knows what could have happened . ''
anyone who knows anything about what happened is asked to contact the police on 101 .

documents.title: tree removal held up by bat discovery
text: work to remove unsafe lime trees in the centre of worcester has been held up due to an unexpected find in one of the trees .
as workmen began to fell trees on new road , which were decaying inside , a bat was discovered in the branches .
an ecologist is now on site to decide what to do next .

an assessment of the trees was commissioned by worcestershire county council 's highways team in response to concerns about their condition and ahead of a potential scheme to raise the road later this year to reduce its flood risk .
author: Briohny Williams
BBC Hereford and Worceser rerpoter

documents.title: severn valley railway share issue tops £ 1m
text: the severn valley railway is well on course to reach its target of raising £ 2.5m through a share issue after raising £ 1m in the first four months .
it passed that mark at the start of the march .
the money is going to be used to fund improvements to its station in bridgnorth and the £ 1 shares will remain on sale until the end of october .

documents.title: crowdfunding success for family of boy whose heart stopped
text: a crowdfunding page set up to help raise money for a tribute garden in memory of an eight-year-old boy who died after suffering a cardiac arrest has more than doubled its target of £ 3,000 .
callum cartlidge , from redditch , was taken by ambulance to the worcestershire royal hospital as the alexandra hospital no longer has a children 's inpatient unit , but died soon after .
his death came less than 24 hours after being discharged from the same hospital after being diagnosed with tonsillitis
the trust said it was investigating
more than £ 6,500 has been raised after his aunt set up the gofundme page last weekend .

documents.title: welland landowners fined for illegally removing hedgerow
text: landowners who illegally removed a hedgerow longer than a football pitch have been ordered to pay more than £ 1,600 in fines and costs after a successful prosecution by malvern hills district council .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: hereford fc : some fans 'an embarrassment '
text: directors at hereford fc say recent behaviour by a small minority of the club 's fans has been an embarrassment .
crowd trouble meant last weekend 's match at didcot town had to be abandoned after the side came from behind to score what could have been a late winner .
directors ken kinnersley and george webb say it 's depressing that non-football concerns are overshadowing good news on the pitch .

although in the main our supporters are great ambassadors for this football club and behave extremely well both home and away , there is no getting away from the fact that on a number of occasions a small minority have behaved in a way that has caused the club embarrassment .
there has to be an element of self-policing from supporters and some individuals do need to take more responsibility for their own behaviour . ''

documents.title: stone hurled through ambulance window
text: stone hurled through ambulance window

documents.title: 'information at their fingertips ' thanks to giant travel screen
text: a giant outdoor touchscreen device has been installed in worcester to help travellers and tourists access information .
worcestershire county council say the new interactive travel information point at the city 's cathedral square is the first of its kind in the uk .
the unit gives live bus and train timetables as well as directions to landmarks and amenities in the city .

worcestershire is at the cutting edge of developing platforms that give the public the information they require to easily move around urban spaces and we were delighted to be involved in this project .
as a first in the uk , it shows the benefits that can be realised from bringing in data from a number of sources and presenting it to the user through an easy-to-use interface . ''
the installation forms part of the £ 20m worcester transport strategy major scheme , which includes funding of £ 13.5m from the department for transport , announced last month .
the council is planning more units at key locations in worcester over the coming months .

documents.title: violent attacker who escaped from open prison now back behind bars
text: a violent attacker who `` jumped the fence '' at an open prison was on the run for just over two months before being tracked down to his girlfriend 's home .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: 'get a grip people ' - anger on social media over police dog campaign
text: the latest twist in the failed campaign to help a retired police dog handler to buy the dog he was working with has sparked a fierce reaction on social media .
a crowdfunding campaign has to date raised thousands to help sergeant david evans buy police dog ivy .
now a. petition 's been launched calling for the chief constable of west mercia police to resign .
over his decision to unite ivy with a new handler .
here 's what you had to say on facebook :
get a grip people , at the end of the day it 's a working dog and was trained to do just that .
we 've seen the police documentaries on tv and you can see how much the dogs really enjoy what they 're doing and the dog will continue to do so with a new handler . ''
as long as she is happy and well looked and continuing to serve with a new handler , i see no reason for the chief constable to let her go .

wow that 's it consider the dogs feeling x how about we train these dogs yes for the police but she is n't a desk gun or paperwork she is a living animal with feelings and wishes , he offered to pay for the dog , this dog has lived every day with its family not the police . ''

documents.title: harriers ' win 'an important victory '
text: kidderminster harriers striker sam austin says saturday 's 3-0 win over alfreton town was an important victory .
harriers remain third in the table , 11 points behind vanarama north leaders afc fylde with a game in hand .
after losing their previous two matches , austin says the result boosts their promotion hopes .
we needed it and we performed well we took a couple of our chances - we could have took more , but we 're just happy with the three points at the end of the day . ''

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : seatbelt dangers and fly-tipping fines
text: this lunchtime on midlands today , we 'll hear from the mother whose 12-year-old son was n't wearing a seatbelt when he died in a car crash .
she 's now helping police in the region raise awareness of the dangers .
we 'll also look at news that one of our midlands ' councils is looking to bring in on-the-spot fines for anyone caught fly-tipping .
those stories and more from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: herefordshire charity expands breast cancer services
text: the herefordshire-based charity breast cancer haven is now offering services in three london hospitals and has a new centre planned in the west midlands .

the charity , which operates from five sites including the worcestershire royal hospital , is expanding to help patients at the whittington hospital , the wellington hospital and university college london hospital .
haven will also be opening a new centre in solihull this october .
our aim at breast cancer haven is to provide an environment where service users feel welcomed , safe , calm and comfortable .
our flagship centres are far removed from a clinical setting and we hope to recreate this in north london by minimising any barriers associated with being in a hospital . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your photos : sunrise in herefordshire and worcestershire
text: you 've taken some amazing shots of this morning 's sunrise .
thanks to bbc weather watchers jenny wren in hereford and sabrina in upton upon severn .

documents.title: taxi driver charged with sex attack
text: taxi driver charged with sex attack

documents.title: paul carrack to headline at worcester
text: the mike and the mechanics ' frontman paul carrack has been named as the latest headliner for this year 's concert of legends at worcestershire county cricket club .
the singer , who 's performed on hits including over my shoulder , the living years and ace 's how long joins billy ocean in performing at the event on 9 september .
the third headliner is yet to be announced .

documents.title: youth throws stone at ambulance windscreen
text: an elderly cardiac patient in worcestershire was delayed from getting to hospital after a gang of youths hit an ambulance with a stone , shattering the .
window .
the ambulance driver was left covered in glass after the incident at just after midnight on sunday morning on the southbound carriageway of the a449 near the mitre oak pub .
a second ambulance had to be sent to take the patient to hospital .
the police searched the area but found no sign of the offenders .
while heading to the worcestershire royal hospital , the driver steve hopkins said he spotted three boys , seemingly in their late teens , walking towards kidderminster .
at the last minute i caught sight of the one in the middle throwing something and the next second the passenger window in the cab exploded covering me in glass .
it was a real shock but thankfully i was n't hurt .
to be honest , i was more concerned about our patient .
it 's a stressful enough situation without something like this happening . ''
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: call for more children to learn to swim
text: a redditch woman , whose brother drowned in a river , says schools could do more to teach pupils to swim .
a new survey has revealed that one in 10 children leaving primary school do n't know how to swim .
richard fellows was 15 when he died in the river arrow in 2014 - his sister chantalle aston is launching a campaign to make people aware of the dangers of swimming in cold water .
it 's an expensive thing to do and if you 've got more than one child , then it becomes even more expensive .
my daughter is in year two now and she has n't even started swimming lessons with the school yet .
i would like to think they 're starting them when they 're five or six and they 're not . ''
the department for education says all schools must teach swimming by the age of 11 .

documents.title: plea to hereford ccg to fund partner 's dying wish to live at home
text: the partner of a woman dying from a rare form of alzheimer 's has sent an emotional plea to nhs hereford clinical commissioning group to fund her dying wish .
author: Droitwich Spa Advertiser

documents.title: 'anyone for tennis ? ' : a pensioner makes a comeback after a stroke
text: a 94-year-old herefordshire pensioner is back on court , after staff helped her fulfil her dream to play tennis again .
win reynolds had a stroke 10 years ago , but when staff at ross court where she lives asked if they could make a wish come true for her , she asked to up a racket again .
the coach at ross tennis centre agreed to help mrs reynolds and now she 's enjoying regular rallies at the nets .
i feel it 's like heaven ha ha , because it 's so different from anything you could do anywhere else .
my son says i look a different person when i 've been up here . ''
author: Kate Justice
Presenter - BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: police dog ivy campaign : calls for chief constable to resign
text: a petition has been launched calling for the chief constable of west mercia police to resign because he refused to let one of the force 's dogs retire with her handler .
sergeant david evans wanted to buy police dog ivy so he could keep her when he retired and a campaign to help him has raised thousands of pounds .
however west mercia police say they are n't allowed to accept such money and ivy is continuing to do very well with her new handler .

documents.title: fa vase : bromsgrove sporting 1-1 cleethorpes town
text: bromsgrove sporting fc 's goalscorer jason cowley feels it 's all to play for when he and his teammates head to cleethorpes town in the second leg of their fa vase semi-final on saturday , 18 march .
the sides drew 1-1 at the victoria ground in the first leg at the weekend .

documents.title: children as young as nine reported to police for cyberbullying
text: children as young as nine were reported to police for offences relating to cyberbullying in south worcestershire last year .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: death of the italian job actor john forgeham 'shock to all '
text: the death of footballers ' wives star john forgeham has been described as a `` shock to all of us '' by his friend , producer simon golding .
the 75-year-old , best known for his roles in the itv drama and the italian job , died on friday .
he was born in kidderminster .

documents.title: 'unsafe ' trees to be removed from road outside cricket ground
text: work to remove unsafe lime trees in worcester will start today .
an independent assessment of the seven trees on new road , outside worcestershire county cricket club , found they were diseased and needed to be taken away as soon as possible .
scans of the trees show a worrying amount of decay due to disease .
two of the trees were recommended to be removed within three months and a further five within six months .
in addition , a further 11 trees require urgent branch removal work . ''

documents.title: your photos of the moon
text: we 've been sent some stunning photos of last night 's very bright moon .
thanks to our weather watchers paul wilde for the top one , taken in redditch , and ruth 's view in beoley for her shot of the moon going down this morning

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store ?
text: after a bright and sunny start , some cloud moving in with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
